name: cement production, Portland | cement, Portland | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11967/documentation

The dataset describes the production of Portland cement (CEM I) in Quebec. It was assumed that 85% of total cement production in Quebec was of this type. Contempra (or Portland-Limestone cement) defined in another dataset is assumed to correspond to 15% of the market. GLO dataset was adapted to Quebec production using the 'US & Canadian Labor-Energy Input Survey 2007' from Portland Cement Association (2008). More specifically, calculations are based on two important technical parameters for the Canadian Cement Plants: 1. An equivalent finished cement ton is composed of 92% clinker production and 8% finished cement production; 2. Capacity Utilization rate (%)- 93.3%. Reference: US & Canadian Energy Input Survey [pg 34, note 2 and pg 36]. A direct link was created for clinker input, since it is always produced on the same site as cement. Therefore, no transport was included.

From cradle, including all upstream activities.

This activity ends with the cement produced in the cement mill. The dataset does not include packaging and administration.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: GLO dataset was adapted to Quebec production using the Athena Institute'Cement and Structural concrete : LCI update 2005' and the 'US & Canadian Labor-Energy Input Survey 2007' from Portland Cement Association (2008).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Parameters for the Canadian Cement Plants were used to represent Quebec's plants.Some exchanges were also extrapolated from the ecoinvent 'cement production, alternative constituents, 6-20%, GLO' dataset, originally based on Swiss data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Inventory data covering the three (3) Quebec cement plants
